Key Match Events: India won by 9 wickets (with 18 balls remaining).
Pre-Game Insights: West Indies are up 2-1 with two to go, but both teams would be looking at the bigger, broader picture ahead of more high-stakes challenges.
India handed Yashasvi Jaiswal a debut in the previous game as a sign of trying out personnel for the 2024 T20 World Cup.
Tilak Varma has emerged as a strong candidate for the No. 4 slot in the ODI squad.
West Indies, under Rovman Powell, are rebuilding their T20I side and have a chance to win back-to-back T20I series for the first time since 2017.
Shimron Hetmyer and Shubman Gill are in the spotlight for their performances.
If fit, Jason Holder should replace Roston Chase for West Indies.
India is expected to stick with the same XI that won them the third T20I.
In the last two T20Is played in Lauderhill, India - batting first both times - posted 191 for 5 and 188 for 7, winning both.
Teams batting first have won 11 of the 13 completed T20Is played in Lauderhill.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Yuzvendra Chahal needs five wickets to become the first Indian, and eighth overall, to take 100 T20I wickets.
Charles is 12 away from becoming the ninth West Indies batter to 1000 T20I runs.
This is India's fifth T20I series under Hardik Pandya. They are yet to lose one.
